theory.brief: Câu tường thuật (Reported Speech) dùng để kể lại lời nói của người khác. Thay đổi thì động từ (lùi một thì), đại từ, và từ chỉ thời gian. 'Said' dùng khi không có tân ngữ, 'told' cần có tân ngữ (me/you/him/her/us/them).
examples: Direct: 'It's broken.' → Reported: The doctor said it was broken.
Direct: 'You have to go.' → Reported: Dad told me I had to go.
Direct: 'I'm going tomorrow.' → Reported: She said she was going the next day.

exercises.answer: The doctor said it was broken.
acceptedAnswers: The doctor said it was broken.
The doctor said it was broken
The doctor said that it was broken.

exercises.question: She __________ me she was tired.
exercises.explanation: Use 'told' when there is an object (me)

exercises.question: They __________ they were going home.
exercises.explanation: Use 'said' when there is no object mentioned

exercises.question: He __________ us the story was true.
exercises.explanation: Use 'told' when there is an object (us)

exercises.question: The teacher __________ the lesson was difficult.
exercises.explanation: Use 'said' when there is no object

exercises.question: "I am tired." → She said she __________ tired.
exercises.answer: was
acceptedAnswers: was
hints: Present simple 'am' changes to past simple 'was'

exercises.question: "We are studying." → They said they __________ studying.
exercises.answer: were
acceptedAnswers: were

exercises.question: "I can help you." → He said he __________ help me.
exercises.answer: could
acceptedAnswers: could

exercises.question: "I will come tomorrow." → She said she __________ come the next day.
exercises.answer: would
acceptedAnswers: would

exercises.question: "I don't like coffee." → He said he __________ like coffee.
exercises.answer: didn't
acceptedAnswers: didn't
did not
hints: Present simple negative changes to past simple

exercises.wrongSentence: He said me he was tired.
exercises.correctSentence: He told me he was tired.
exercises.explanation: Use 'told' (not 'said') when there is an object (me)
'Told' needs an object. Without object, use 'said'

exercises.wrongSentence: They said they are going home.
exercises.correctSentence: They said they were going home.
exercises.explanation: In reported speech, present tense changes to past tense

exercises.wrongSentence: He told me he can swim.
exercises.correctSentence: He told me he could swim.

exercises.wrongSentence: He said he is feeling better.
exercises.correctSentence: He said he was feeling better.
exercises.explanation: Present continuous 'is feeling' changes to past continuous 'was feeling'

exercises.wrongSentence: She told to me she was busy.
exercises.correctSentence: She told me she was busy.
exercises.explanation: 'told' is followed directly by object, no 'to'

exercises.title: Report what Fiona and others said

lines.speaker: News
lines.text: Fiona said: "I hurt my head. I'm resting in hospital now."

lines.speaker: Reporter
lines.text: Fiona Thompson said _____ _____ _____ her head and _____ _____ resting in hospital _____.
lines.answer: she had hurt, she was, then
acceptedAnswers: she had hurt, she was, then
she had hurt...she was...then

lines.speaker: News
lines.text: Fiona's teacher said: "I looked after her and gave first aid."

lines.speaker: Reporter
lines.text: Fiona's swimming teacher said _____ _____ looked after her and _____ first aid.
acceptedAnswers: she had, given
she had...given
he had, given

exercises.title: Report a conversation
exercises.instruction: Think about a conversation you had yesterday. Write what 3 different people said to you using reported speech. Use 'said' and 'told' correctly, and remember to change tenses, pronouns, and time words.
exercises.example: Example: My mum told me I had to finish my homework. My friend said he was going to the cinema. My teacher said we would have a test the next day.

exercises.title: Report a dialogue
exercises.instruction: Imagine you had a conversation with your friend yesterday about weekend plans. First write the direct speech (what you both actually said), then report the conversation using reported speech. Write at least 4 exchanges.
exercises.example: Direct: Me: 'I'm going to the cinema tomorrow.' Friend: 'Can I come with you?' | Reported: I told my friend I was going to the cinema the next day. My friend asked if he could come with me.
